alert.note: Alert for Furnas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 5:44PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Furnas County through 630 PM CDT... At 543 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of perhaps producing a landspout tornado along a line extending from Beaver City to 6 miles south of Lebanon. Movement was north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, and penny size hail are the main threats. A brief landspout tornado cannot be ruled out in the area, but this threat is currently higher just south of Furnas County. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Beaver City, Edison, Wilsonville and Hendley. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
